text: Mikoš Rnjaković (born 20 April 1964) is a Serbian former cyclist. He competed in two events at the 1992 Summer Olympics as an Independent Olympic Participant. He won the Tour de Hongrie in 2001. ==References== Category:1964 births Category:Living people Category:Serbian male cyclists Category:Yugoslav male cyclists Category:Olympic cyclists as Independent Olympic Participants Category:Cyclists at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:People from Požega, Serbia
title: Mikoš Rnjaković
